messages.message: Quick question - if a document is misclassified and you are in human review, if you reclassify a doc, is it supposed to then force try an extraction? When I reclassify, it seems to just do the reclassification. If a doc is misclassified, how can we reroute for extraction?
It does not re-run extraction. It’s on the roadmap, but for now if the new classification has a schema you will then have to enter in that data manually.
if this is set up via API - is manual data entry happening on the downstream system in that case?
Human review is the end of the road AFAIK. Even an API run would have to have results edited in human review, or export the data and edit it that way.
guess I’m not sure what the downstream system might be.

a workaround could be that when we reclassify the document, it would expose the fields expected for that document all blank - which would effectively be building out the JSON. Know this is not the long term solution
That actually should happen in the human review UI. Starting in 24.08.
which should be released today or tomorrow. A previous issue with the schema wasn’t enabling that functionality in 24.06
